author: Staff Reporter
text:
Residents of Kulayankarisal who submitted a petition to the Collector in Thoothukudi on Monday. —Photo: N. Rajesh

Residents of Kulayankarisal thronged the Collectorate here on Monday seeking the intervention of the district administration to safeguard lands owned by a committee for temple.

In a petition submitted to Collector M. Ravikumar, they said that the community of Thandupathu Nadar Uravinmurai had been maintaining Sri Periyapirati temple for the last five generations now.

The temple committee was in possession of three acres of land at Sirupadu in Kumaragiri panchayat, they said and alleged that Velmurugan of Umarikadu had felled trees on the temple committee’s land to encroach upon 25 cents with the help of a retired revenue official. Hence, they sought action against him.
title: Safeguard lands: residents
